feed.title: SAP Community - SAP BTP, ABAP environment
feed.subtitle: SAP BTP, ABAP environment Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP FIORI | Timestamp conversion in fiori front end
entry.content:
Hi SAP  Experts,

I've created a timestamp column in the backend by concatenating the creation date (VBAK-ERDAT) and creation time (VBAK-ERZET). The resulting timestamp is in the format YYYYMMDDHHMMSS, and the values are being generated as expected.

Example:

  • Creation Date: April 25, 2025 (20250425)
  • Creation Time: 5:14:06 AM (051406)
  • Timestamp (backend): 20250425051406

    However, after exposing the CDS view through a Fiori application, the timestamp displayed on the frontend appears to have an additional ~5.5 hours added to it.

    Frontend Example:

    • Timestamp displayed: April 25, 2025, 10:44:06 AM (20250425104406)

      It seems that the SAP Gateway or the Fiori frontend is performing a timezone conversion on the timestamp value.

      As per SAP Note 3215029, this behavior aligns with the standard design. The timestamp shown in UI5 applications may differ from backend values depending on the browser's timezone settings.

      Has anyone else encountered a similar issue? Any suggestions or best practices to handle this discrepancy would be greatly appreciated.

      Best regards,

      Mukhtar

entry.title: Fetch table content from a webpage in sap build process automation
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Need your expert's suggestion,

I’m building an automation in sap build process automation that needs to pull the exchange‑rate table from our bank’s website and update those rates into SAP S/4HANA.

Bank is not providing any API to fetch exchange rate.

As of now, I am using "Execute Command" to open a website and using keystroke to select the content of webpage.

Now I have to fetch exchange rate table from bank website and update the same in S/4 Hana, I tried multiple possible way like custom script, but somehow, I am not able to fetch the information. Kindly help.

entry.title: Fetch Destination configuration details from BTP in ABAP layer
entry.content:
We are configuring destinations in BTP environment in order to fetch details from External API. There is an additional section namely additional properties in destination configuration level where we can fill in relevant parameters along with its key.

In ABAP how can we fetch the same?

We are in ABAP Cloud environment. 

CL_HTTP_DESTINATION_PROVIDER=>CREATE_BY_CLOUD_DESTINATION is not bring the details related to additional properties.

Inside the same class, there is an usage of Class CL_CLOUD_DESTINATION however its API state is not released hence cannot be used independently in Cloud system.

Kindly help here.

entry.title: Issue CDN on Workzone Lauchpad with Referenced Fiori App - deploy on Cloud foundry
entry.content:
Hi Guys,

   We are facing issues with CDN ( Content Delivery Network ) on Workzone Lauchpad after deploy on Clound Foundry

    We  have an custom app that works great on BAS tests, but on dependencies we have this another central finance app:

"dependencies": {  "minUI5Version": "1.114.0",
"libs": {  "sap.fin.gl.lib.posting": {
"lazy": false
},

on BTP under HTML5 is Okay it was wrong, but after updating xs-app file they were solved so we have follow on xs-app:

  {
      "source": "^/resources/sap/fin/gl/lib/posting/(.*)$",
      "target": "/sap/bc/ui5_ui5/sap/fin_gl_post_lib/$1",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
      "destination": "MYDESTINATION"
    },
 
after adding it to Workzone Lauchpad it is still going to 
sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/1.136.2/resources/sap/fin/gl/lib/posting/library-preload.js   
Instead of going to the Backend to load this files.
 
We tried to add ResourceRoots like:
"resourceRoots": {
"sap.fin.gl.lib.posting": "./sap/bc/ui5_ui5/sap/fin_gl_post_lib"
},
 
But still going to wrong place.
 
Do you guys know how to fix it?
 
( its a mandatory requirement to have this app on BTP, We can not deploy it on backend )

@Wouter @FabioPagoti  any ideias? thankks

entry.title: Modify statement in a determination giving short dump, going in infinite loop.
entry.content:
I have a single determination in my behavior definition as follows,

determination setCountryCode on save { field Country; create; update; }

following is the implementation in behavior pool,

CLASS lhc_ZI_INVESTOR DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    METHODS get_global_authorizations FOR GLOBAL AUTHORIZATION
      IMPORTING REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR zi_investor RESULT result.

    METHODS setcountrycode FOR DETERMINE ON save
      IMPORTING keys FOR zi_investor~setcountrycode.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS lhc_ZI_INVESTOR IMPLEMENTATION.

METHOD setCountryCode.


    READ ENTITIES OF zi_investor IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY zi_investor
        FIELDS ( Country Mobile )
        WITH CORRESPONDING #( keys )
      RESULT DATA(lt_mobile).

    IF lt_mobile IS NOT INITIAL.

      LOOP AT lt_mobile ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_mobile>).

        IF <fs_mobile>-Country = 'India'.
          <fs_mobile>-Mobile = |+91 | & |{ <fs_mobile>-Mobile }|.
        ENDIF.

      ENDLOOP.

    ENDIF.

    MODIFY ENTITIES OF zi_investor IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY zi_investor
        UPDATE FIELDS ( Mobile )
        WITH VALUE #( FOR item IN lt_mobile ( %tky = item-%tky Mobile = item-Mobile ) ).

  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

This modify statement at the end is somehow going in an infinte loop, how can I fix this, I saw one post but there, two determinations were calling each other, but here I only have a single determination, I also have a validation but that should not be relevant, please help, thanks.

entry.title: Reading child entity in parent entity's determination doesn't work
entry.content:
I am trying to update the total number of items in child entity (Material) in a field in parent entity (Catalogue), however, the read statment returns empty rows for the child entity. How can I fix this, I want to get the count of all the rows in the child entity and update this number in a field in parent entity. Following is the behavior definition and implementation. Thanks.

managed implementation in class zbp_i_catalogue unique;
strict ( 2 );
with draft;

define behavior for zI_catalogue //alias <alias_name>
persistent table zcatalogue
draft table zcatalogue_dr
lock master total etag LastChangedAt
authorization master ( global )
{

  create ( authorization : global );
  update;
  delete;

  field ( readonly, numbering : managed ) CatalogueId;
  field ( readonly ) CategoryDescription, Active, TotalItems, Version,
  CreatedAt, CreatedBy, LastChangedAt, LastChangedBy;

  association _materials { create; with draft; }

  determination saveTotalItems on save { create; }

  draft action Activate optimized;
  draft action Discard;
  draft action Edit;
  draft action Resume;
  draft determine action Prepare;

  mapping for zcatalogue
    {
      CatalogueId         = catalogue_id;
      Name                = name;
      Description         = description;
      Category            = category;
      CategoryDescription = category_description;
      Active              = active;
      TotalItems          = total_items;
      Version             = version;
      ValidFrom           = valid_from;
      ValidTo             = valid_to;
      LastChangedAt       = last_changed_at;
      LastChangedBy       = last_changed_by;
      CreatedBy           = created_by;
      CreatedAt           = created_at;
    }
}

define behavior for zI_material //alias <alias_name>
persistent table zmaterial
draft table zmaterial_dr
lock dependent by _catalogue
authorization dependent by _catalogue
{
  update;
  delete;
  field ( readonly, numbering : managed ) MaterialId;
  field ( readonly ) CatalogueId, CatalogueName, CreatedAt, CreatedBy, LastChangedAt, LastChangedBy;
  
  association _catalogue { with draft; }

  mapping for zmaterial
    {
      MaterialId    = material_id;
      CatalogueId   = catalogue_id;
      CatalogueName = catalogue_name;
      Description   = description;
      Price         = price;
      Currency      = currency;
      Uom           = uom;
      LastChangedAt = last_changed_at;
      LastChangedBy = last_changed_by;
      CreatedBy     = created_by;
      CreatedAt     = created_at;
    }
}
CLASS lhc_zI_catalogue DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    METHODS saveTotalItems FOR DETERMINE ON SAVE
      IMPORTING keys FOR zI_catalogue~saveTotalItems.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS lhc_zI_catalogue IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD saveTotalItems.

    READ ENTITIES OF zI_catalogue IN LOCAL MODE
        ENTITY zI_material
        ALL FIELDS WITH VALUE #(
            FOR key IN keys (
                CatalogueId = key-CatalogueId
            )
        )
        RESULT DATA(lt_materials).

    IF lt_materials IS NOT INITIAL.

      MODIFY ENTITIES OF zI_catalogue IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY zI_catalogue
      UPDATE FIELDS ( TotalItems )
      WITH VALUE #( FOR _key IN keys ( %tky = _key-%tky TotalItems = lines( lt_materials ) ) ).

    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

entry.title: email not received in post user creation SCIM cloud identity services
entry.content:
I am currently working with SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS), automating user creation through the SCIM API. My goal is to have users receive the standard activation (welcome) email as soon as they are created and activated via the API, just as they do when activated manually through the IAS web interface.

Steps taken:

  1. POST /scim/Users
    I create the user with the following call:
JSON
 
{
  "schemas": ["urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"],
  "userName": "Dave.test",
  "name": {
    "familyName": "Dave",
    "givenName": "Dave"
  },
  "emails": [
    {
      "value": "dave.test@gmail.com",
      "primary": true
    }
  ],
  "active": false
}
  1. PATCH /scim/Users/{id}
    I then activate the user with this PATCH request:
JSON
 
{
  "schemas": ["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:PatchOp"],
  "Operations": [
    {
      "op": "Replace",
      "path": "active",
      "value": true
    }
  ]
}
  1. User status verification:
    After the PATCH, the user status is "active": true both via API and in the IAS interface.

Observed behavior:

  • When I activate the user through the IAS interface, the activation/welcome email is sent immediately.
  • When I activate the user via SCIM API, the user is marked as active, but the activation email is not sent.
  • The email template is active and works (tested via UI), the email infrastructure (SMTP) is correct, and the emails do not end up in spam.
  • I do not have access to a Monitoring/Email Delivery section in IAS to check if the email was attempted.

How can i fix?

Thanks

entry.title: Schedule RAP Service in BTP Job Scheduler
entry.content:
We have a ABAP cloud system where we have a created a RAP Application. Its a very basic app with a GET operation only.
Our main agenda is to explore the usage of BTP Job scheduler. I am aware that CAPM application can be scheduled easily in Job scheduler.

Kindly let me know if it is possible to schedule RAP Service as a job in Job scheduler. If yes, please help with some working steps for the same.

entry.title: Are any RAP BO Reflection APIs available in BTP ABAP environment?
entry.content:
Hello, colleagues. 

Does anyone know any cloud ready reflection API for RAP BO? Are there any plans to make any reflection API for RAP BO?

By the way, class CL_ABAP_BEHVDESCR doesn't have release contract and I can't use it.  Also, the class seems not fully comply with my tasks (read all action for BDEF).

Futhermore, I've tried XCO library, it has quite poor reading capabilities. XCO generation part doesn't give possibility to study existing BDEF at all. Also I've tried classes for abapGIT serialization, I wasn't successful too(not released).

If you know the API, please point out how to get all actions defined in BDEF. 

P.S. It would be great to get something really powerfull to read and parse all BDEF, to get all nodes or all RAP actions or RAP functions etc.

entry.title: How to prevent deletion of specific entry in Event 03 (Table Maintenance) when choose multiple rows
entry.content:
Hi experts, I am using Event 03: Before Deleting the Data for my table ZSAP03_EMAIL Now I write this FORM to prevent user from deleting user with USER_ID = DEV-145. When I delete a line with DEV-145 the system works correctly, but when I select multiple lines, including DEV-145 the system deletes DEV-145 as well. Please give me detailed solutions

 

FORM on_delete.
FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_user_id> TYPE any.

ASSIGN COMPONENT 'USER_ID' OF STRUCTURE <vim_total_struc> TO <fs_user_id>.

IF sy-subrc = 0 AND <fs_user_id> = 'DEV-145'.

MESSAGE 'Default row DEV-145 cannot be deleted!' TYPE 'E'.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Possibility for Mass Production Order Confirmation in Foreground from template in SAP Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a requirement, where users perform "Mass Confirmation of production order's" through Excel template. Also, the confirmation screen - CO11N have certain validations (using Badi) in place for the order to be confirmed.

Each order is confirmed in foreground, allowing users to manipulate "Goods movement data - yield Qty, posting date, Storage location, Execution date, Component Qty" to be within validations placed. This is possible in ECC.

Requirement in Public cloud system:

1) User should be able to upload list of Production orders with other info through Template.

2) User should perform confirmation in the foreground with data picked from template and also allowing to change on screen confirmation data.

Has anyone achieved or any possible leads for the same to be replicated in SAP Public Cloud environment?

Thankyou.

entry.title: How to automatically assign a business role in BTP ABAP environment via IPS
entry.content:
Hi experts,

we have set up user provisioning between SAP Cloud Identity Services and our BTP ABAP environment. This is working perfectly fine.

Now we want to automatically assign the business users in the BTP ABAP environment to certain business roles based on the group assignment in the Cloud Identity Services via IPS.

Example:

All users assinged to group "BTP ABAP Environment Admins" (with technical ID "abap_admins") in IAS should be assigned to business role "Administrator" (with technical ID "SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR")

The basic transformation of the target BTP ABAP environment system in IPS is as follows:

{
	"user": {
		"condition": "isValidEmail($.emails[0].value) && (('%a4c.roles.prefix%' === 'null') || ($.groups[?(@.display =~ /%a4c.roles.prefix%.*/)] empty false))",
		"mappings": [
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.userName",
				"targetPath": "$.personExternalID"
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.externalId",
				"targetPath": "$.personExternalID",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:enterprise:2.0:User']['employeeNumber']",
				"targetPath": "$.personExternalID",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.personID",
				"sourceVariable": "entityIdTargetSystem"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.markedForArchivingIndicator",
				"constant": "false"
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$['urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:sap:2.0:User']['userUuid']",
				"targetPath": "$.user.globalUserID",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePaths": [
					"$.userType"
				],
				"targetPath": "$.businessPartnerRoleCode",
				"valueMappings": [
					{
						"key": [
							"Employee"
						],
						"mappedValue": "BUP003"
					}
				],
				"type": "valueMapping",
				"defaultValue": "BUP003"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.validityPeriod.startDate",
				"sourceVariable": "currentDate",
				"scope": "createEntity"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.validityPeriod.endDate",
				"constant": "9999-12-31",
				"scope": "createEntity"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.user.validityPeriod.startDate",
				"sourceVariable": "currentDate",
				"scope": "createEntity"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.user.validityPeriod.endDate",
				"constant": "9999-12-31",
				"scope": "createEntity"
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.name.givenName",
				"targetPath": "$.personalInformation.firstName",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.name.familyName",
				"targetPath": "$.personalInformation.lastName"
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.name.middleName",
				"targetPath": "$.personalInformation.middleName",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.name.formatted",
				"targetPath": "$.personalInformation.personFullName",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.userName",
				"targetPath": "$.user.userName"
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.locale",
				"targetPath": "$.user.logonLanguageCode",
				"optional": true
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.emails[0].value",
				"targetPath": "$.workplaceInformation.emailAddress"
			},
			{
				"targetPath": "$.user.lockedIndicator",
				"condition": "$.active == false",
				"constant": "true"
			}
		]
	},
	"group": {
		"condition": "isAttributeWithOptionalPrefix($.displayName, a4c.roles.prefix) && isAttributeWithOptionalPrefix($['urn:sap:cloud:scim:schemas:extension:custom:2.0:Group']['name'], a4c.roles.prefix) && (isRegularGroup() || isApplicationSpecificGroup())",
		"mappings": [
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.displayName",
				"targetVariable": "entityIdTargetSystem",
				"scope": "createEntity",
				"functions": [
					{
						"function": "replaceFirstString",
						"condition": "isAttributeWithMandatoryPrefix(@, a4c.roles.prefix)",
						"regex": "%a4c.roles.prefix%",
						"replacement": ""
					}
				]
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.displayName",
				"targetPath": "$.displayName",
				"functions": [
					{
						"function": "replaceFirstString",
						"condition": "isAttributeWithMandatoryPrefix(@, a4c.roles.prefix)",
						"regex": "%a4c.roles.prefix%",
						"replacement": ""
					}
				]
			},
			{
				"sourcePath": "$.members[*].value",
				"targetPath": "$.members[?(@.value)]",
				"optional": true,
				"preserveArrayWithSingleElement": true,
				"functions": [
					{
						"function": "resolveEntityIds"
					}
				]
			}
		]
	}
}

Below "user" > "mappings" we added following configuration:

{
	"condition": "$.groups[?(@.value == 'abap_admins')] empty false",
	"targetPath": "$.user.userRoleAssignments[0].businessRole",
	"constant": "SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR"
}

We also tried following:

{
	"condition": "$.groups[?(@.value == 'abap_admins')] empty false",
	"targetPath": "$.user.businessRoles[0].roleID",
	"constant": "SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR"
}

Unfortunately none is working.

How can I automatically assign business roles in the BTP ABAP environment using SAP IPS?

 

regards

René

entry.title: Managed with additional save with full data implemenation data saves in DB and disappears in few sec
entry.content:
Hi Team ,

1. I was trying to create a simple report with the combination of Billing hearder and item details wtih custom table .

2. An action button for selecting the record and process it ...on processing custom logic we need to save the updated value as per the logic and save in the custom table ( means updating the custom table with new value ).

while doing so value getting saved in the custom table but disappears in few seconds . i am unable to figure out where went wrong here is the code snippet below 

define bheavior with cds view comibation of standard and custom table with persistan custom table and mapping the custom 

On action button code logic to process the new value

READ ENTITIES OF XXXX IN LOCAL MODE ENTITY XXX ALL FIELDS WITH CORRESPONDING #( keys )
RESULT DATA(lt_xxx)

 
LOOP AT lt_XXX ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_XXX>).
        <fs_XXX>-field1   = lw_Wa-field1.
        <fs_XXX>-field2   = lw_Wa-field2.
       <fs_XXX>-field3   = lw_Wa-field3.
ENDLOOP.
 

MODIFY ENTITIES OF XXXX IN LOCAL MODE ENTITY XXX
UPDATE FIELDS (field1 field2 field3 )
WITH VALUE #( FOR lw_key IN lt_t1
(           %key-key1 = lw_key-%key-key1
            %key-key2 = lw_key-%key-key2

field1 = lw_key-field1
field1 = lw_key-field1
field1 = lw_key-field1
) )
FAILED DATA(lt_failed)
REPORTED DATA(lt_reported)
MAPPED DATA(lt_mapped).

read table lt_xxx INTO DATA(ls_xxx) index 1.

INSERT VALUE #(
%tky = ls_keys-%tky
%param = ls_xxx ) INTO TABLE result.

and in save_modified method.

LOOP AT update-XXX INTO DATA(ls_XXX).
CLEAR lt_ewayt3_u[].

lw_ewayt3-key1 = ls_update-key1.
lw_ewayt3-key2 = ls_update-key2.
lw_ewayt3-field1 = ls_update-field1.
lw_ewayt3-field2 = ls_update-field2.
lw_ewayt3-field3 = ls_update-field3.

APPEND ls_XXX TO lt_u.

UPDATE zxxx FROM TABLE @ lt_u.

its saving the value in the DB but disappears again.

please suggest me where it wrong 
ENDLOOP.

entry.title: Integration with SuccessFactors lms table and ui5 Application
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

My requirement is to create simple ui5 application to record external training events and the record should be saved to SuccessFactors lms table through the Api call,
i have developed the ui and called the Api but not able to save the data in the lms table, Im using btp environment and trying to setup the destination configuration but not sure what the missing part, I'm Not having much exposure in btp , so currently stuck here, I have bought our sf url and token service url from sf team, do i need any additional info from them ? is there anything to do to consume the configured destination to access with in the business application studio

  var oPayload = {
                "learningEventRecords": [
                    {
                        "learningEvent": {
                            "title": sTitle,
                            "description": sDescription,
                            "completionDate": sCompletionDate, // format YYYY-MM-DD or as required
                            "totalHours": fTotalHours,
                            "creditHours": fCreditHours,
                            "provider": sProvider,
                            "format": sFormat,
                            "category": sCategory
                            // Add other required fields here
                        }
                    }
                ]
            };

            // API URL - replace with your actual endpoint URL
            var sUrl = "SF_Learning_API/learning/odatav4/public/user/learningEvent/v1/recordLearningEvents";

            // AJAX POST call
            $.ajax({
                url: sUrl,
                method: "POST",
                contentType: "application/json",
                data: JSON.stringify(oPayload),
                headers: {
                    // Add authorization header if needed, e.g.:
                    // "Authorization": "Bearer " + yourAccessToken
                },
                success: function (oData, textStatus, jqXHR) {
                    sap.m.MessageToast.show("Learning event recorded successfully!");
                },
                error: function (jqXHR, textStatus, errorThrown) {
                    sap.m.MessageBox.error("Error recording learning event: " + jqXHR.responseText);
                }
            });
